g:HTMLPanel.p: For the longest time, I have loved countdowns and lists. The Book of Lists was my favorite book growing up. I remember Q107 (a local radio station) doing their first Top 1,007 classic rock songs in the late 80s. I remember CFNY 102.1 doing their Top 1,002 alternative songs ever in 1991.

When I was 19 years old, I made an anniversary gift for my then-girlfriend (now-wife) of the Top 730 songs of all-time. It was a true labor of love - it took me hours to collate the countdown then record every last song on over 30 90-minute cassette tapes (remember those?). I even used a mixer to overlap the songs. At the time, we had been going out for two years, so the 730 number meant 1 song for every day of our love. Lists were definitely my thing.

Over the past 10 years, I have discovered so much great music by reading other people's lists online - lists from publications like Pitchfork and Rolling Stone, lists from celebrities and lists from random internet users. The fact that someone actually picked and ranked the songs means that those picks are more qualified and meaningful than robot-generated recommendations.

And so here we are in 2014 with the birth of Fave100. I am asking everyone online with a love of music to share their list. Not only will this create an amazing array of individual lists (that you can listen to at anytime), but Fave100 has the technology to calculate aggregate lists based on everyone's lists, all in near-real-time.
So, what are you waiting for? Get your list on!
P. S. Check out my current alltime list, as well as classic rock and dance - I have a feeling my lists will never be done. :)
